location: A HOUSE IN THE HOLLYWOOD HILLS

text: The view of downtown Los Angeles from the enormous, ornat is extraordinary.  A small outdoor dinner party is in pro A MAGICIAN is entertaining guests.  Playing cards and coi appear and disappear in his nimble hands.
EDWARD HARRIS stands at the window, impassively looking d at the party.  Edward is a handsome, well groomed man of forty.  He looks tired; the kind of fatigue that can't be by a night's sleep.

(a murmur) Left pocket. And indeed, down below, the magician pulls the coin from left pocket of the incredulous WOMAN's silk blazer.  More laughter and applause. The study is in keeping with the rest of the house.  Luxu Everything the best.  WILLIAM STUCKEY, Edward's contempor is a crafty looking lawyer who is the party host.  VANCE investment banker.  His assistant JAKE, is a financial researcher.  The other men are INVESTMENT BANKERS.  They in dark suits and power ties.  On the table are stacks of documents and folders, the name "KROSS INDUSTRIES" is pro on many of the folders.

Our banks certainly doesn't want to discourage Harris Enterprises from investing in California. We think this is a great new venue for you but you've got to understand the mergers and acquisitions market is changing. With the upswing in inflation we have to make these offerings tempting to offset the risk.
Look, we're talking about hard assets and a straight liquidation. We have over a thousand man hours in this deal.
(losing patience) This is a "no brainer".  There's no risk for you.  No one has ever lost money backing Mr. Harris.
Not yet.  But ship building is a new endeavor for you...
(cuts him off) Come on.  You know we're not going to go into ship building. Besides, you're the ones with the troubled track record, not us!

Bill, be reasonable.  If you're really going to digest Kross Industries that quickly eighteen should not be such a problem. Besides, I don't think there's anywhere else you can go for the money in the time you have.
It's unacceptable. Edward turns from the window.  He hasn't miss a thing.  A eyes are on him.

Draymen Heux has offered me seventy-five in the pool at sixteen and a half.  I can secure the other half personally.  You have until tomorrow morning to make me a better offer. The bankers speechlessly stare at him.
The meeting is over, gentlemen. He turns away.  The bankers look at one another.  They ri Silence as they exit.  When the door closes.  Stuckey exp with laughter.
Hah!  Did you see the look on their faces?
You don't think we pushed too hard?
NO way!  They'll come back.  They can't afford not to.  Edward, that bluff was beautiful.
Maybe I should have made it rhyme. The others stare at him, uncertain.  Stuckey laughs.  The others follow suit.
(looking at his watch) Well!  It's late.  We've been at this long enough. Stuckey rises.  Edward ushers Vance and Jake toward the d
Gentlemen, enjoy the party.  The magician's wonderful. Vance and Jake exit.
(calling after them) Watch your left pocket. A BUTLER has entered the room.
Phone call, Mr. Harris.  It's Miss Charles.
Cynthia?  Is she coming out?
We're about to find out.  Go on. Take care of your guests. Stuckey exits the room as Edward crosses to the telephone
(into phone) Where are you, Cynthia? (beat) I see. (pausing, getting angry) No, I don't expect you to be at my beck-and-call.  Are you coming or not?
Edward descends the long, curved stairway.  He has Vance tow.
(all business) Prepare the filing papers.  Have them ready by the middle of the week.  I'll tell you when to submit them. The PEOPLE talking and drinking on the stairway gravitate toward Edward.
Edward!
(turning on the charm) Yes!
Will we see you at the polo matches Wednesday?
Wouldn't miss it. (abruptly; to Vance) I want this done fast and easy. No slip-ups.  I want to be back in New York by Saturday.  Got it? He deftly keeps making his way through the crowd.

Stuckey is sipping champagne and talking to a beautiful WOMAN in a tight sheath of an evening dress.  An elegant ELIZABETH STUCKEY approaches from behind him.  She taps h the shoulder and he turns, startled.
Bill?
(flustered) Oh... Hi, honey... Millicent, uh, uh, Millicent.
Lowell.
Lowell, right.  My wife, Elizabeth.
(ignoring her) Is Edward leaving? Stuckey looks up to see Edward moving quickly toward the Stuckey abruptly leaves the two woman together to follow

Edward comes out of the house.  Jags, a limo with waiting DRIVER and two BMW's pack the circular driveway behind a Ferrari.  The limo driver leaps to attention at the sight Edward.  Edward stands, making an obvious effort to keep impatience under control.  Stuckey comes out of the house down the walk.
What's up, where you going?
Give me your car keys, will you, I'm going back to my hotel.
At least stay for a drink.  This party's for you.
Apologize to Elizabeth for me. Stuckey gropes uncertainly in his pocket for keys.
Listen, there're some major local talent inside just dying to meet you...
(as if delighted) Really?  Some high class gold digger who speaks French better than I do? (turning away) No, thank you.  I just got off the phone with one.
Cynthia's not coming?
No. Edward grabs the keys out of Stuckey's hand.  He crosses black Ferrari and gets in.
Let your driver take you.  We'll move the cars... Edward starts the car.
Can you drive a stick? The car lurches forward with a squeal of wheels and promp stalls.
Edward, give me a break! With a squeal of tires, the Ferrari bucks out of the driv and... stalls again.
Love this car!  Is it new?
Yes!  And you don't even know where you're going! Edward starts it again and heads uncertainly uphill.  Stu watching, throws up his hands.
That's the wrong way!

head_text.subj: CREDITS BEGIN AS IN A SERIES OF CROSSCUTS

text: The Ferrari, moving fast through the Hollywood Hills, pas large, beautiful homes... Edward shifts, grinding gears..

The Ferrari comes to a red light and pulls up next to a D The GIRL in the Colt looks at Edward and his car admiring Edward feeling confident now, revs the engine.  The light green.  Edward immediately stalls the Ferrari.  The Colt him in the dust.
Edward drives.  He blinks, shakes his head as if trying t himself of his own tired thoughts.

The Ferrari comes to the intersection of OUTPOST and FRAN stops.  Edward gets out of the car.  He looks at the stre signs.  He has no idea where he is.  He signs.  He gets b in the car and takes off on Franklin heading East.

A crumbling old apartment building.  Dark alley ways, des parking lot. The Ferrari -- blink and you miss it -- motors past the b looking very out of place on the street. PANNING UP  A building facade of lit windows and metal fi escape.  One window in particular.  A GIRL stands there i short kimono, looking down.  And then she turns away.
A SERIES OF SHOTS to see her dressing.

VIVIAN turns and stares at herself in a grainy, cracked b mirror.  She is twenty years old and a prostitute.  Make- applied to give her a hard, older look doesn't quite succ She'd be innocently beautiful without it.  She is wearing shorts, a tight tube top, thigh high boots.  She stares a herself, not really liking what she sees.  A moment.  She turns off the light and walks out of the bedroom.

Faded, peeling walls.  Thread bare, dirty carpet.  Vivian the apartment door behind her and starts down the dim hal A door suddenly opens, startling her.  An unshaved, enorm pot bellied MAN in a stained t-shirt stares at Vivian wit eyes.
Vivian. Vivian turns some "tough" on him.
Yeah, what?
Rent.  You're late.
Don't give me that.  Kit gave it to you yesterday, cash.
Kit give me nothin'.
(suddenly uncertain) You bullshittin' me?
Of rent I do not bullshit. Vivian hurries at a run back down the hallway.
By the end of the week or you're otta here. (a beat) By the way, you look very nice tonight!
Vivian pulls a coffee can off a shelf.  She pulls off the It's empty.  She tosses the can away, starts for the door opens it.
Down the hallway, the landlord is standing in front of hi doorway, talking to a FAT WOMAN.  They both glance up. Vivian quickly closes the door.  She doesn't want to deal them.
Vivian comes off the fire escape onto the sidewalk.  She away.

Vivian walks along, urgently looking for something... som A BABBLING STREET-TYPE goes by happily talking to himself He wears an "I Love Hollywood" t-shirt. Vivian passes TOURISTS but doesn't notice them any more t she pays attention to the VAGRANT she passes further on, in a doorway. A LONG-HAIRED KID on a SKATEBOARD goes by dropping off li bags to various STREET-TYPES. A BARKER-TYPE stands in front of a photo store urging tou to come in and take a photo with a cardboard cut-out of a star.  Some go in. Vivian hurries past a group of rubbernecking JAPANESE TOU A BLACK PROSTITUTE in a mini skirt strolls toward her.  A passes.  The DRIVER stares at Vivian with interest.  She him.  The black prostitute approaches the car.

Hey, baby, you lookin' for a date? The Driver looks her over.  The Black Prostitute gets in car and it drives away. A GROUP OF MEN, mostly drug dealers, hang out at an all n coffee shop.  They WHISTLE and make obscene gestures and as Vivian hurries by.  She ignores them and goes next doo a falafel stand.  Half a dozen PEOPLE sit at dirty tables
Behind the counter are a MAN and a WOMAN, Vietnamese cook frying food, trying to ignore the unsavory crowd camped i shop.
Chan, you seen Kit tonight?
Hi, hi!  No see nothing.
You do, tell her I'm looking for her.
Looking good, bay-bee.
Yeah, you too, D'Nai.  If Kit comes in here, tell her stay. Both of them nod and smile at Vivian.  Vivian exits.

Skateboard zips by a GROUP.  We SEE a police car parked a entrance to an alcove.  Also, an ambulance.  The bubblegu lights are going.  A CROWD has gathered.  The happy man w the "I Love Hollywood" t-shirt and a POLICE OFFICER are e in tense conversation.
They just pulled her out of a dumpster in the back.  Now talk to me.
I tell you, man, I don't know who she hang with.
She have a pimp?

Cocaine her pimp, man.  She a strawberry.  She be out on these streets, day in, day out, tradin' her sorry ass for crack.  And now she dead from it. Vivian rushes up to join the outskirts of the crowd as th of a YOUNG GIRL is pulled out of an open dumpster and car towards the waiting ambulance.  For a moment Vivian think it's... no, Vivian turns grimly away. Vivian surveys the dark street.  And suddenly sees who's looking for.  Walks.

We SEE a young, tough-looking MAN and WOMAN trying on wig The STOREKEEPER is a man wearing a dress and wild wig.  T girl, KIT, is around 18, is dark haired and thin.  The yo man, CARLOS, has his arm sloppily draped across Kit's sho They giggle about something, both obviously high.  Kit lo up, bleary-eyed.  She stops.  Vivian is standing in front her.
You spent it on drugs, didn't you?
Hi, Viv.  Carlos, you know my roommate, Viv.
Lookin' good, baby.
(ignoring him) Did you blow it all, Kit?  Is it all gone?
Carlos had some great rock.
I bet. (beat) That was our rent! Carlos attempts to put an arm around Vivian's shoulders.
Calm down, Chica. Vivian throws him off.
Ey!  What is it you wan', baby? I can fix you up.
Beat it, scum bucket!
You kiss your mother with that mouth?  Your frien' still owes me 200.
(to Kit) Let's go. Skateboard appears suddenly, blocking Vivian and Kit's pa

Get out of my face or I'll have those cops on your ass in two seconds. Carlos glares at her.  He looks down toward the lights of cop cars.  One of the POLICEMEN looks towards them, curio Vivian waves at the cop.
(threatening to Vivian) Don't take no dates tonight, chica, you got one with me. Vivian grabs Kit by the arm and pulls her across the Boul
Vivian and Kit sit at a table sipping tea.  Vivian is sti mad at her.
We worked for that money.  We were gonna put together enough to get out of that dump we live in, get off this street.

Viv... don't be stupid.  We're whores. Vivian looks like she wants to weep.  Or scream.  She doe neither.  She slowly nods.  Kit's sorry she said that. KIT (cont'd) So I blew our stash.  We could make it all back with one good night on the streets.
I just saw somebody pulled out of a dumpster.  I wonder how much she made tonight?
Don't be mad at me.  I'll pay you back.  I promise.
I thought you were giving up that drug shit.
I will.  I'm trying. (a beat) Meanwhile I got some crack left, you wanna get high?
No, let's go to work.  Okay?
Okay. (then touches her hand) I'm sorry I said your dream was stupid.
Edward's Ferrari turns onto Hollywood Blvd., finally out the Hollywood Hills.
Vivian and Kit are out trying to hustle John's in passing Vivian strikes a sexy pose at the bus stop.  Kit is talki another prostitute, RACHEL.
No no, honey.  You see these stars on the sidewalk.  Me and Vivian work from Don Ameche all the way up to Roy Rogers. This is our office.  We got seniority.  Get off our corner.
I was just taking a rest here. Besides, she's new. (points to Vivian)
But I'm old.  Go rest up by Monty Hall or Debra Paget where you belong. Rachel walks off.
(looks at passing cars) Looks slow tonight.
Maybe we should get a pimp. Carlos likes you and --
Forget it.  We work for it.  We keep it. They keep hustling.
I can't handle this tonight. I'm going home.
(stares at her) That crack is burning a hole in your pocket.  There isn't even milk in the fridge.  The rent's due.  Now come on --
(suddenly) Hey, hey -- There's a rent.
He's not gonna want us. The Ferrari goes by and stops.
(calls out to Vivian) Excuse me.
(excited) Don't take less than a hundred. You look hot tonight.  And remember, don't mouth off.  They don't like that.
Okay.  Go home.  But take it easy on that shit. Kit gives Vivian a quick hug.

You're the greatest.  I'll wait up for you. And then Kit is off, moving quickly away.  Vivian turns. stares at the Ferrari, loathing it and all it represents. then it's as if Vivian turns a switch.  She fluffs her ma hair, throws her shoulders back, thrusting her breasts ou sashays towards the car, a sexy, friendly smile on her fa In the driver's seat of the Ferrari, Edward is looking fu and distracted.  Vivian leans over the passenger window.
Hey Sugar, you lookin' for a date?
What's that?
You looking' for some company?
Uh, no.  How do I get to Beverly Hills?
What? (dropping the come on) You gonna tell me you're lost?
Yes.
Great.  What do I look like a tourguide? Edward takes a good look at her.
(a beat) No, you look like a hooker.
Actually, I'm a movie star out for a walk.
Good.  Can you tell me how to get to Beverly Hills?
Sure.  For five bucks.
That's ridiculous.
The price just went up to ten.
Why don't you just do it out of the kindness of your heart?
(sweetly) Sit... and spin.

Sit-and-spin. (amused) Alright... why not? He pulls out his money clip. Vivian suddenly freezes.  On the sidewalk up ahead, Carlo Skateboard.  Carlos flashes an evil, menacing grin.  He m to Skateboard, they start forward.
(holding up a bill) You have change for a twenty. Vivian pulls open the door of the car and jumps in.

For twenty, Ill show you personal.  Drive. Edward stares at her.  She smiles sweetly. VIVIAN (cont'd) Make a "U-ee".  Beverly Hills is the other way. The Ferrari pulls away, passing Carlos on the sidewalk.
Nice car.  Yours?
(as he grinds the gears; wincing) No.
Stolen?
Not exactly. He smiles.  Vivian smiles back.
Mind if I turn on some heat?
If you can figure it out, be my guest. Vivian reaches out, turns on the heat.
Very good.  You're obviously mechanical.
(laughs) You're not from L.A., huh?
New York.
What motel you staying at?
Hotel.
Okay, what hotel?
Regent Beverly Wilshire.  I bet you know it.
(annoyed at his tone) Yeah, I peed in the fountain there once.  Give me a break. Edward glances over, amused.  It hits him that she really an attractive girl.
What's your name?
What do you want it to be? (a beat) Vivian, my name's Vivian.
You like being a hooker, Vivian?
It pays.
So do day jobs.
(sarcastic) Day jobs, yeah.  I've tried them. (a beat) Turn right.
The Ferrari glides along a seedy, West Hollywood section Santa Monica.
Must be dangerous.  Hooking.

Tell me about it.  L.A. is suffering from a wacko epidemic. And who knows where half the guys I pick up have been.  I mean, I use condoms.  Always.  And I get checked out once a month at the free clinic.  Not only am I better in the sack than an amateur, I'm probably safer.
Very good.  You ought to have that printed up on your business card.
(a moment) If you're making fun of me, I don't like it.
Sorry.  If I did, I didn't mean to. Vivian unconsciously bites her fingernails.
Ugly habit, biting your nails.
You don't know habits, you think this is ugly. But she puts her hands in her lap.  She looks out the win She's safe from Carlos.
Okay, pull over.  Let me out. I've got to get back to work. Edward pulls the Ferrari to the curb and stops. VIVIAN (cont'd) Stay on this street and you'll hit Beverly Hills.
What do you charge for company, Vivian?
Company would cost you... a hundred dollars.
For the whole night?
For an hour.
You're joking.
I never joke about money.
Neither do I. (a moment; amused) A hundred bucks an hour though. That's pretty stiff. She reaches across the seat.  Her hand goes in his lap.
No, but it's getting there.
Vivian, how much to put up with me for the entire night?
You couldn't afford it. Vivian starts to get out of the car.
Try me. A moment.  Vivian's sexy smile comes on.
Three hundred.
Fine.
What's your name, lover.
Edward.  My name is Edward.
Edward... you got it! Edward gets out of the car.  Vivian looks at him confused
Get in.  This side.
What?
You know how to drive a stick? Vivian moves around the car.
Better believe it.
Then let's go.  It's worth 300 just so I don't have to drive. They get in the car.
She starts the car, revs it.
Here we go Edward.
The Ferrari peels out, fishtails madly and SCREAMS up the street.

Thousands of tiny white lights sparkle along the walls of Regent Beverly Wilshire Hotel.  Bright flags are illumina by carefully placed spotlights.  The Ferrari SCREAMS into driveway and comes to a jarring stop by the front door.
Edward takes a moment to get his breath.  He gestures tow the back.
My raincoat's in the back.  Put it on.
Why?
You may feel more comfortable. This is not the kind of place that rents rooms by the hour.
You mean they don't have hookers.
Every place has hookers, but if this hotel has hookers, they don't look like they're...
Off the boulevard.
Exactly.
As they walk in, Vivian is tying the trenchcoat.

Great.  Now I took like a hooker in a trenchcoat. She looks up.  She stops in her tracks.  The lobby is bri and spacious, filled with thick carved wood paneling.  Ev this hour there is a great deal of activity.  MEN in busi suits and WOMEN in furs and jewels are passing by.  Vivia face quickly conceals the sudden awe she feels at the sig all this luxury.  Vivian matter of factly reaches out and Edward's arm.
So let's go. Edward guides them across the lobby.  They reach the elev and go inside.
The young ELEVATOR OPERATOR is dressed in a clean red uni that seems just a bit too tight.  As the elevator doors c he nods toward Edward.
Evening, sir.
Good evening.  Penthouse.
Penthouse.  My, my. She sees the operator glancing at her.
The penthouse.  And step on it.

Edward and Vivian come out of the elevator into a hallway leading to a single doorway with two heavy wood doors.  E pulls out his key and unlocks the doors.  With a gentle p the door slide open in unison.  Edward gestures to Vivian go inside.  She does.  Edward closes the doors behind her

As Vivian steps into the room she has the sensation of fa off the top of the building.  In front of her is a sunken room with massive windows revealing the sparkling lights city below.  For the first time, she is speechless.  Edwa closes the door and walks past her down the steps to the room.  Edward picks up a phone.  Vivian checks out the ro
(into the phone) Room service. (to Vivian) What do you drink?
Diet coke.
(into the phone) Send up a bottle of Crystal champagne.
Can I have some chips?
(into the phone) -- and a bowl of strawberries. Thank you. Vivian makes her way down the steps to the living room. stares at the view.
(to Vivian) Impressed? Vivian is impressed but she's not going to admit it.

You kidding?  I come here all the time.  As a matter of fact they do rent this room by the hour. Edward smiles.  He sits down in a comfortable chair and l back.  Vivian looks at him. VIVIAN (cont'd) Well, now that you have me for the night, what are you going to do with me?
Want to know something?  I don't quite know.  I hadn't planned this.
Do you plan everything?
(a small smile) Always.
Well, the meter's running, it's your money.  Speaking of which, cash'll do.  In advance.

Fair enough. He rises.  Takes out his wallet.  Standing over her, he d THREE crisp, new hundred dollar bills in Vivian's lap.  S picks up the bills, stares at them, trying not to be impr She puts the money in her jacket.  She realizes Edward is standing over her as if waiting. She leans forward, reaches out to unzip his pants.  He ab turns away.
Let's talk some more first.
Right. (brightly) So!  In town on business?
(taking off his jacket) Uh-huh.
Let me guess, you're a... lawyer.
(loosening his tie) And why do you say that?
(a small smile) I dunno... you have that sharp, useless look. Edward almost smiles.  He sits across from her again.
Sounds like you've known a lot of lawyers.
I've known a lot of everybody. A chime goes off to indicate there's someone at the door.
Champagne. He starts to sit up.  Vivian motions for him to stay put.

Hey.  I might as well make myself useful. Edward sits back down.  Vivian waltzes up the steps and o the front door.  A WAITER comes into the room with a silv cart; on it is a bucket of champagne and a covered bowl.
Where would you like it?
Where would we like it?

Where would we like it?  Here'll be fine. The Waiter carries it down the steps and sets it in the m of the living room.  He turns and heads back up the stair pauses near Vivian, staring.  Vivian stares back at him.
What are you looking at? The Waiter glances away uncomfortably and exits.  Vivian the door behind him.  Vivian marches back down the stairs
I think he wanted you to tip him.

Tsk.  Excuse me, I didn't think he had change for a hundred. Edward crosses to the silver stand.  Vivian watches with interest as he twirls the champagne bottle in the ice buc VIVIAN (cont'd) You have a wife?  Girlfriend?
I have both. Edward lifts the bottle out.  He deftly pops the cork on bottle without losing a drop of champagne.
Where are they?  Shopping together?

They should be.  They're both good at it. Edward pours the champagne into a single long stemmed gla hands one to Vivian. EDWARD (cont'd) My ex-wife lives in London in what used to be my home. My girlfriend is in New York moving out of my apartment even as we speak.  Cheers. He drinks, nods approvingly.
It's a very good year.
Oooh, thank god. Edward laughs softly.  She sips it.  To her surprise, rea likes it.  Edward lifts a lid on a silver bowl to reveal enormous strawberries.
Try a strawberry.
Why?
Because they bring out the flavor of the champagne.
Jesus, you act like you're seducing some Valley girl you picked up in a dance club.

Vivian... the meter's running... cooperate. A moment.  She slowly eats a strawberry.  The juice of it her lips.  Her eyes are like smoke as she takes a sensuou of champagne, licks away the stain of the strawberry.  Hi haven't left her.
(softly) You really are a very beautiful girl.
(husky-voiced) Just a romantic, that's you.
Yes... Her mouth is so wet and inviting... he leans closer...
Me too. He's about to kiss her... VIVIAN (cont'd) Not on the lips. He freezes.  She pulls his head down to her breast.

Edward and Vivian on the bed.  He is on his back, his sho and head resting against the headboard.  She is astride h hands resting on his chest, rocking... in control, confid very much liking the fire she's kindled in his eyes.
(touching her breasts) What do you like?

If I want you to turn me on I'll pay you three hundred.  Just lay back and let me drive. Smiling, Vivian reaches behind her, touching him.  He tri to groan.  She's moving faster now.  Edward suddenly pull violently to him, he rolls her over...
A heavy spray of water comes down upon Edward.  He stands quietly letting it wash over him.  He turns off the showe steps out of the stall, picks up a towel and dries himsel

Edward stares.  His expensive clothes are on the floor, haphazardly dropped everywhere.  Vivian's clothes, as tat as they are, are neatly folded and piled on a chair.  The incongruity of it touches Edward in a sad way.  He looks the bed.  Vivian is fast asleep.  Her heavy makeup has lo been rubbed off.  Asleep, her wary, smart-ass attitude is She looks like a sweet, gentle girl.  He stares at her a longer.  He turns, goes into the living room.  Vivian ope eyes.  Through the open door she sees Edward sitting in a room chair.  He is reading contracts.
The sun is coming up as HOTEL EMPLOYEE hoses down the sid in front of the hotel.
A WOMAN EMPLOYEE is vacuuming the lobby.  She sees someth and pauses.  She pulls a dead leaf from one of the potted plants.
The elevator doors open and A WAITER rolls a cart out int hallway.  He takes it to the doors of the penthouse.  He the bell.
It's open.

The Waiter wheels in a table of food, coffee, champagne a orange juice.  Edward dressed in suit pants, white shirt suspenders, stands in the living room talking into a cord phone.  Edward points the Waiter to the dining table.
(into the phone) Sorry.  Go ahead.
William Stuckey is behind his desk.
Kross knows we're after his company.  He wants to talk with you.  I don't think you should.
The Waiter returns.  Edward signs the bill.  The Waiter e
I want to.
Edward, if the three of us sit down together we might as well announce our plans in the Wall Street Journal.
I'll see him alone.  Everyone knows you're my muscle.  We'll make it social.  Tell Kross I'll meet him for dinner.  Tonight if you can arrange it.
You shouldn't go alone.  He might claim that you tried to black mail him.
Bill, we're businessmen, not the damn mafia.  I'll see you in the office.  By the way, about your car...
Oh, god, what?

(smiling) I'll bring it back. Edward hangs up.  He pours a glass of orange juice and ta a sip, thinking.  Something makes him turn.  Vivian, wear a monogrammed hotel terry robe, is standing uncertainly i bedroom doorway.
Good morning.
You didn't wake me.  I'll be out of here in a minute.
No hurry.  Would you like some breakfast? She's hungry and the breakfast looks great.
Only if you do. Edward sits.  Waits.  Vivian sits across from him.  Edwar serves them breakfast.
Did you sleep well?
Yeah.  Too good.  I forgot where I was.
Occupational hazard? She looks at him sharply, sees that he means no offense, relaxes.
Where'd you go?
I took the couch.  I had some work to do. (hesitating) About last night...
Oooh, Baby, you were the best. I was beside myself.
Mmm, I could tell.
I just hope it was worth three hundred bucks.
I'd say you give a good dollar value. They share a small smile.  They eat.
Do you ever... enjoy it?
I like guys if that's what you're asking.  Not that I trust'm.
No?  Why's that?
"Occupational hazard". A moment.  Edward chuckles.  Vivian grins. VIVIAN (cont'd) what do you do anyway?
I buy companies.
No shit.  They expensive? He almost smiles.  She almost smiles back.
The one I'm buying this week will cost around 150 million.
... dollars? He nods.  This time Vivian is impressed. VIVIAN (cont'd) You are major league, baby.  Your mother must be very proud. Edward is oddly pleased at her reaction.
The closet door is open.  Edward reaches for a tie.  In t closet are about a dozen expensive looking suits, shirts, etc.  She follows him in.
So what a ya do with the companies once you buy'm?
(fumbling with the tie) I sell them.
What?  Why? She undoes his knot and starts over. VIVIAN (cont'd) At ease, let me do that.  Part of the all night services.
By breaking up a company's assets
What are assets?

(nervous) Hello.  Can you help me? The Salesgirl looks Vivian up and down.  A Pause.  Vivian her "the stare" and straightens up.  We see the Salesgirl reaction change.
(confidently) I'm looking for a dress, nothing too flashy, not too sexy, conservative.  In a size six.

(uncomfortable under Vivian's stare) Do... do you have a charge account with us? Vivian smiles and draws out Edward's American Express car The Salesgirl nods and quickly moves to a rack of dresses find Vivian's size.

Vivian tries on different clothes under Edward and the Salesgirl's supervision. Vivian comes happily out of the dressing room wearing a l cut, spangled and fringed outfit.  Edward shakes his hand Salesgirl holds a classic tweed ensemble over Vivian's ou Vivian scowls.
(sighing) I look like fucking Nancy Reagan.
The Salesgirl shows Edward clothes by Ann Taylor.  He tur to find Vivian happily holding up a tiny, low cut leather Edward shakes his head in mock disapproval.  Vivian scowl
Vivian is wearing an elegant pastel dress.  Edward is sta at the store's bar, watching and talking on the telephone
Stuckey and Vance are pouring over stock reports, talking Edward on the speaker phone.
Kross came out of his corner swinging.  He started buying up all available stock as soon as the market opened.
(almost to himself) He's a tough old son of a bitch... Edward is watching Vivian.  She pulls the hem of her skir to mid thigh.  She looks hopefully over to Edward.  Edwar shakes his head.
It's up to ten and a quarter.
Offer nine and a half.  Bring them back down to earth.
Goddamit!  Where is he getting the money to fight?
Someone's loaning it to him. Get on it right away.

Our contract guys are working on the Kross pension funds. There's another forty million there.  We can bleed'm dry. There is a sudden hesitation in Edward's eyes.  He watche Vivian tries on a hat.  She preens for him.  He smiles.
(to Vance & Stuckey) Put the pension funds on hold until I say otherwise.
(surprised) We're letting them slide?
I want the treatment plant licenses to be top priority right now.
But, Edward...
Do it. Edward hangs up and takes a long look at Vivian.  She mov to him.
(looks at his watch) You're on your own now, Vivian. I've got to get to work.  Be sensible and you can keep everything.  Spend too much and it all goes back. Vivian hugs him again.

Vivian walks along Rodeo Drive.  She looks lovely in the dress and new, white shoes.  A pretty, white hat is the f touch.  She carries a bag containing her old clothes.  Sh at a trashcan and ceremonially throws the offending items

We SEES Vivian in each department within the store with different SALESPEOPLE.  She happily and confidently tries a variety of dresses, hats, shoes, accesarries, etc. 1)  Vivian is in a dressing stall.  She tosses a dress ou to a waiting SALESWOMAN.
Not me! 2)  A SALESWOMAN holds a long, purple evening gown.
(imitating Bridget) Horrid! 3)  Vivian is admiring a pair of beautiful suede dress pu Her attention is drawn to the SALESMEN'S exotic hand-pain tie.

Where'd you get your tie? 4)  Vivian stands in front of an enormous tie rack with t Salesman, a dozen wild, swirling designed ties are hangin his outstretched arm.  Vivian picks out the brightest one smiles.

Vivian's arms are filled with clothing boxes and bags.  S feels like she owns the block.  A well-dressed MAN passes smiling politely.  Vivian's nose lifts as she happily ign him. Suddenly Vivian stops.  She's about to pass the shop she thrown out of.  Vivian takes a breath and enters the shop
Vivian enters.  The moment she steps through the door, Vi courage leaves her. The saleswoman is waiting on a CUSTOMER.
(to the customer) Isn't this lovely?  I think it would look wonderful on you. Vivian musters her courage.  She takes a deep breath and forward.
(to her customer) Would you like to try it on?
'Scume me. Both the saleswoman and her customer look up.  The salesw smiles pleasantly.
Yes?
Do you remember me?
No, I'm sorry, I don't.
I was in here yesterday. Vivian slowly raises her middle finger.  The recognition to dawn in the saleswoman's eyes.  Vivian's courage begin return.

Yeah.  That's right.  It's me. I want you to know something. You made me feel terrible. I wasn't dressed right and you said I didn't belong here.  Well, I do.  You're the one that was wrong, not me.  And I want to tell you something else.  I'm never gonna shop here again as long as I live. And with that, Vivian turns and walks out. The saleswoman is stunned.  A beat.  The customer thrusts dress into the saleswoman's arm as if offended by Vivian' speech and leaves the store also.

Mr. Thomas looks up from the desk.  And stares.  Vivian a BELLHOP stroll through the hotel entrance and across the lobby to the elevator.  The bellhop's arms are packed wit and shopping bags.  Mr. Thomas can't help it.  He smiles himself.
Vivian opens the front door for the Bellhop who carries i packages.  She motions for him to place them on the couch does.  Vivian happily tips him with a five dollar bill. exits.  The door closes.
Wheee!!! Vivian does a giddy spin and falls onto the couch.
Stuckey enters.  Edward is standing at the end of a long meeting table.  He is serving himself coffee from a tray.

(gloating) You were right.  Kross mortgaged everything he has down to his grandson's college tuition to secure loans from a bank.  Not just any bank.  One we do business with. Edward just sips his coffee. STUCKEY (cont'd) It goes without saying that your business means a great deal more to them than our friend Kross's. (a beat) All you have to do is make a call. Edward is silent.  Stuckey is again surprised.

Excuse me for saying this but what is wrong with you this week? First, you go soft on the pension funds.  Now, you're giving him the chance to get away?  As of two minutes ago, you are committed to the tune of over fifty million dollars --
Come on, Bill, don't talk to me about how much money's involved. It's my money.
And some of it's mine.  Edward, his jugular's exposed. Edward hesitates.  Then:
Get the bank on the phone for me.

Edward enters.  He closes the door.  He turns.  And stops beautiful, candlelit, food laden table has been set up in middle of the room.  Champagne and wine chills in a bucke A fire burns in the fireplace.  Music is playing.
Hi. Edward turns.  And stares again.  Vivian stands in the be doorway.  She is wearing an exquisite silk dressing gown. looks incredibly beautiful.
I thought maybe you'd like dinner.
Thank you.  I would. (he fingers her dressing gown) Nice.
Wait till you see what I have on underneath.
Please. She opens the dressing gown.  What she has on underneath absolutely nothing.  Edward crosses to her.  Taking her i arms, he lifts her up and kisses her breasts.
What about dinner?
Dinner can wait.
The bathroom is lit by candles.  Vivian and Edward are in marble tub.  Vivian sits behind Edward.  She lazily washe shoulders and back with a large sponge.
You always been rich?
No.
Seems like it.  I guess it's easy to get used to, huh?

Easier than learning how to be poor. (a moment; and then:) My father's family was wealthy. When I was young there were cars and houses, private schools, nannies.  But then my father divorced my mother to marry another woman.  And he took his money with him. Silence.
Keep talkin'.  I like hearin'.

Not much to tell.  I went to public school.  Went to university on scholarship.  Went to work for an investment firm. In eight years I owned it. (and then; growing very quiet) My father was chairman of the board of the third company I ever went after.  I swallowed that company and shit out the pieces. One of the pieces was him. Vivian softly traces small patterns on Edward's shoulders a finger.
You still mad at'm?
He died a long time ago. She gently rests her head on his back.

PANNING BELLIES  People are sunbathing by the pool. Overweight... lobster red... old and stretch-marked... fi white... and then gorgeous.  The gorgeous is Vivian.  She wearing a miniscule bikini and sunglasses.
Miss Vivian? She looks up.  A young WAITER, looking a little dry-mouth the sight of her, is holding a telephone.
You have a call.  Mr. Harris.
(taking the phone) Hi, baby. (a moment) I'll be ready.  Bye. She hangs up.  She looks at the Waiter, confused.
What do you wear to polo?
Horses and riders crash and careen on the playing field. enthusiastic crowd cheers.

head_text.subj: DOWN OFF THE EDGE OF THE FIELD

text: a tailgate party using Cadillacs and Rolls Royces is in progress.  Horses and riders thunder by a crowd of very well-dressed, successful-looking people -- celebrities, e socialites, aficionados -- most of whom ignore the game. are there to see and be seen much more than to watch a po match.

Vivian and Edward make their way towards the party.  Edwa wearing his new tie.  Vivian is looking very chic and bea in one of her new outfits.  Not that it's helping -- the the people, the wealth -- everything here suddenly has he overwhelmed.  She suddenly stops.
You're really pushing it, bringing me here.
I think it's exciting.
What id we run into someone I know?
I really doubt anyone here frequents Hollywood Boulevard.
You did. A VOICE calls out.
Edward! They turn.  William Stuckey is with a group of people.  H them over. STUCKEY (cont'd) Come on!  Over here! Edward takes Vivian's arm and leads her forward.
Stuckey grins and shakes Edward's hand.
(looking at Vivian) Well, well, well... Vivian dislikes this guy on sight.  Dislikes the frosty l woman at his side.
Bill, I'd like you to meet Vivian.
(holding out a hand; smiling) Bill Stuckey, Vivian.  My wife, Elizabeth.
Hi. Elizabeth Stuckey stretches her thin lips in a cold smile
Lots of fun people here.  Let me get you two some champagne. He moves quickly away.
Excuse me. She moves to greet someone else.  Vivian and Edward surve milling CROWD.
(sarcastic) Real genuine guy.
He's good at what he does.
You could freeze ice on his wife's ass.  She anything like your ex?
(a small smile) Shall we mingle?
A goal is scored.
Edward watches and guides her, Vivian sips champagne and and chats and wins over different PEOPLE.
A group of PEOPLE.
I simply love your dress, Vivian.
This old thing?
Of course, a figure like yours can wear anything.  You must work out constantly.
I lead a very physical life.
Are you into running, Vivian?
I'm into walking.  I walk a lot.
In another group of PEOPLE.
You look awfully familiar, Vivian. Haven't we run into one another at the spa in La Costa?
Well, I do often spa there.
Edward and Elizabeth Stuckey watch Vivian laugh and chat a group of WOMEN.
Edward, she's marvelous.  Warm and witty and down to earth.
(with pleasure) She is, isn't she.
So unlike your usuals.  Where on earth did you find her? Edward smiles enigmatically.  Taking an hors d'oeuvres of passing WAITERS's tray, he starts forward.

We're good together.  He has to admit it.  I've been just what he wants me to be.  I say the right things, I know the right people, I give wonderful parties. No question, no arguments, no embarrassments.  It works for both of us. That makes Vivian think.  And then she smiles as she sees approaching.  Vivian moves to him.
Edward, these women here, I don't think any of'm like the guys they're with.  They're just into it for the money.
I'm sure that's true for some of them.
I thought I was the pro.  These women make me feel like an amateur.
(a beat) Ready to stomp sod?

head_text.subj: IN A SERIES OF SHOTS TO MUSIC

text: The CROWD engages in sod stomping.  They drink champagne. make a dance out of it.  They laugh.  Shoes get stuck in mud.  It's ludicrous -- these people in their suits and f clothes, replacing divots and stepping over the horse shi In a corner of the field, grazing horses stare, seemingly disbelief. Vivian is having a wonderful time.  And then, as she move towards the outside of the crowd she sees someone staring her from over among some of the riders and grazing horses David Kross smiles at Vivian.  She hesitates... and then crosses towards him.
Hi.
Hi.  I never thought stomping in grass could be so much fun.
(laughs) I like your hat.
Huh?  Oh... yeah.  S'okay? (pleased; a moment) Uhm... how're... business things going.
Let's not talk about it, it's too depressing.  Come on, I'll show you Thunder.
Please, we hardly know each other.
Thunder's a horse.  Come on.
They approach the sweating mount.  David Kross caresses t horses muzzle.
Hey, big guy, you getting tired, yet?  I am.  This is Vivian. (a beat; and then:) You two been together long?  You and Edward?
No.
Hope to be? To Vivian's surprise, the question causes a pang inside.
It's... it's not like that.
I see.  Well.  Maybe that means you'd have lunch with me sometime then. Vivian is suddenly silent.  She looks away. DAVID (cont'd) I'm sorry, am I being too forward?
You don't know anything about me.
I'd like to find out.  You don't know anything about me either. That's why people have lunch. But something holds Vivian back, a feeling.
William Stuckey turns... stops... stares.  He sees Vivian David Kross standing together.  He stares, his mind racin anxious, angry look on his face.
Stuckey has Edward off to the side.  He is talking to him a low, earnest voice.
Fill me in on this.  How'd you and Vivian meet?
We just did.
(grinning) Come on, you can tell me.  I sure would like to know where a guy runs into a girl as attractive as this.
The night I left your house, I was lost.  I was looking for directions.
And you just happened to run into her.  Great.  What's she do?  She work?
Yes...
Doing what?
Vivian's in sales.
Sales, really?  That's great. What does she sell? Edward's eyes narrow.
Why do you want to know?

Hear me out.  I've known you a long time.  I see a difference in you this week.  Like that tie. I'm suddenly wondering if this girl's not the difference. Especially when I see her talking with David Kross.
Vivian turns away from the bar, now holding two glasses o champagne.  She scans the crowd for Edward.
She met him at dinner last night... I like this tie.
So now they're best friends? Edward, this girl appears out of nowhere and now I see her talking to a guy whose company we're trying to buy.  It's too convenient.
You're being ridiculous.
Industrial espionage is not ridiculous.  Edward, how do you know she hasn't attached herself to you so she can bring Kross back information?
Christ, Bill, she's not a spy, she's a hooker.  I picked her up off Hollywood Boulevard.
as she hear loud sudden LAUGHTER.  She turns.  She sees t it's Stuckey laughing.  Smiling, Vivian starts towards th two glasses of champagne.
I swear to God, you are the only millionaire I ever heard of who'd go looking for a goddam bargain streetwalker! Edward sees Vivian coming.

Let's drop it, shall we? Edward turns.  He smiles gently as Vivian quietly approac and hands him his glass of champagne. A group of BUSINESSMEN are standing a short distance away One of them calls out:
Edward!  May we have your opinion on something?
(to Vivian and Stuckey) Excuse me a moment. He moves to join the group of men.  Stuckey gives Vivian broad smile.
Having a good time, Vivian?
Yeah.  Thanks.
All this must be quite a change from Hollywood Boulevard. Vivian looks as if she's been struck.
What?
It's okay.  Edward told me.  Your secret's safe with me. Stuckey runs his hand up her arm. STUCKEY (cont'd) What do you charge, Vivian? Maybe you and I could get together after Edward leaves.
(forcing a bitter smile) Yeah.  Sure.  Why not.  Call me at the Regent Beverly Wilshire.
I just might do that. He moves away.  Vivian turns.  Edward looks up from his conversation, sees her looking at him.  He smiles, raises glass in a small toast.  A moment.  Vivian toasts him bac
They enter.  Edward switches on a light.  Vivian comes do steps into the room.  Edward follows after her.
You're awfully quiet.  You haven't said a word since the party. As Edward touches her shoulder, Vivian suddenly spins and explodes with anger.
You asshole!  I can't believe what a --!
Vivian, what the -- Tears well in Vivian's eyes as she yells at him.
Clean the slut up, take her out, huh?!  What are you trying to prove!?  I'm not a piece of meat for you to offer to your friends!
I don't know what you're talking about.
I've been with stinking old men who've made me want to puke but I've never had anyone make me feel as dirty as you did tonight.
Would you please calm down.  Tell me what happened.
Stuckey!  He wants an "appointment" with me after you leave.  You my pimp now or did he think that up on his own? Edward looks guiltily away.
What was I supposed to do? (a beat) I told the truth.  Why should the truth upset you?  It's not as if you're from a convent.
I want my fucking money.  I'm getting out of here.  I don't want anything more to do with you.
Can we talk about this?  Can you just try to calm down?
Your goddamned friend, he thinks the only reason I'm with you is for the money. A tear falls from Vivian's eyes.
(defiantly) Well, it's true.  Just pay me what you owe me and I'm gone.
Vivian...
Pay me!  Before I pick up this chair and smash your face in.
Fine.  I'm only here a couple of more days and I'm not going to spend them fighting with you.
Fuck off.
I'll call you a cab.  If you want the clothes, pack them up. Vivian stands quietly for a moment.  And then she turns a walks into the bedroom.

Vivian starts roughly picking up her clothes in the dim l of the bedroom.  As she does she starts crying.  With eac of clothing the tears come down harder.  Edward appears a doorway.  His face is genuinely concerned.
Vivian... I'm sorry.  I wasn't prepared for questions about us. It was an idiotic and insensitive thing I did.  I should have known that it would hurt you.
I'm not hurt.  It doesn't hurt you when somebody pisses on you, it just pissed you off.
I really am sorry. Vivian lets the clothes fall from her arms.  Sobbing, she limply.
You hurt me. Edward goes to her and wraps his arms around her shoulder She touches his hand.  He sits on the bed.  He pulls her and wraps his arms around her, holds her tight.
I'll make it up to you.
Edward, carrying a briefcase, moves jauntily down a long hallway.  Stuckey trails after him.
This is no time to disappear. We're in too far.
Bill?  Stop panicking.  Kross isn't going anywhere and I don't need to spend the rest of the day watching his stock go down.  I'll be in the office tomorrow.
Promise me you'll read those contracts by then.
Goodbye, Bill. Stuckey stops.  He calls after Edward.
Shit... By tomorrow, Edward! Edward hurries on.
Edward exits out of his limo and walks to the front doors
Edward smiles, moving jauntily to the elevators.  Mr. Tho at the front desk notices Edward's happy mood.
Good afternoon, Mr. Harris.

Afternoon. Edward's attention is taken by the glittering jewelry dis in the hotel jewelry store window.  He detours from the elevators and moves to the window for a closer look.  He a moment and enters the jewelry store.

Vivian comes out of the bedroom into the living room wear an elegant red sequined evening dress.  She looks incredi beautiful.  She sees the phone.  A thought occurs to her going to it, she picks it up.  Waits.
C'mon, Kit... No answer.  She hears someone at the door.  She hangs up. Edward enters.  He is carrying a small case.  He stops at sight of Vivian.
Do I look okay?
(a small smile) Hmm... let's see... no, there's something missing. He holds up the small case.
What's that?

I don't want you to get too excited... these are on loan... however... Vivian's jaw drops.  Edward is holding a diamond and ruby necklace in his hands, holds it as if it might melt if he breathed too hard.  Edward behind Vivian, fastens the necklace around her neck.
This is made for a princess. I think she'd approve of you wearing it tonight.  There. Come look. He leads her to a mirror.  She stares at her reflection.
Edward, I can't.
Shush.  Of course you can.
What if I lose it?
You won't.
What if someone tries to steal it?
I'll guard them and you with my life.
A limo pulls onto the tarmac at Burbank Airport.  A PILOT a leather jacket and sunglasses hurries forward to open t door.  Edward -- now wearing evening clothes -- and Vivia out of the limo.
Your plane is ready to go, Mr. Harris.
Very good.
Plane? Taking her arm, Edward leads her across the tarmac.
You don't want to go all the way to San Francisco in a limousine, do you?  I don't.
Where are you taking me!?
To meet some friends.  Rudolpho, a poet... Benoit, a landlord... Mimi, a flower maker...
Huh?
The opera. Up ahead is a waiting private jet, its engines already HU She is speechless.  Edward grins, loving the look on her
The corporate jet takes off down the landing strip.

Edward and Vivian are alone in the passenger lounge of th Vivian can't believe the cabin.  It is a comfortable room featuring a long couch that curves across two walls, buil bar, television and stereo.  Edward is once again, going papers.
I've never been on a plane before.

I'm glad you like it.  Now be quiet, I've really got to read these. Vivian fluffs her hair up.  She makes a happy, excited gr sound -- Rrrrr!  A wicked gleam comes to her eye. She walks over to Edward and stands in front of him.  He up.  She parts the thigh high slit in her gown to expose quarters.  She begins to unfasten the garters one at a ti
Vivian, what do you think you're doing? Edward watches silk stockings slide down Vivian's lovely
Being quiet. She reaches out and gently caresses Edward's face.  Edwar down his papers.
The setting sun casts an incredibly glow over the city an coast.
You ever been in love with anyone?

Vivian is at the window, looking out.  She carefully puts earrings back on.  She stares, mesmerized by the skyline, golden gate bridge in the distance.  She turns.  Edward i buttoning his shirt.  He is silent.
Sorry.  You're not paying me to ask you question like that.
Vivian.  I'm paying you to be you.  Be you. (a beat) Have you?  Ever been in love with anyone?

You mean, besides Elvis? (turning back to the window) I'm a human being.  Sure.  Once. First time I ever ran away from home, I got as far as Atlanta. I met this boy.  He'd been with his parents on their way to Chicago.  They stopped at a gas station.  He went to the john. When he came back they'd split. We sorta started looking out for each other.  Aw, he was sweet. And boy, was he good looking, y'know, dark hair and eyes. The chicken hawks were on him all the time.  He hated that. Sometimes we'd find a safe place to crash nights and we'd curl up together and we'd talk about all these crazy things.  The two of us getting married someday. Having kids.  Stupid stuff.
What happened to him? A moment.  Vivian shrugs.

My father found me.  Dragged me home.  I don't know why, he never seemed to like me much when I was there. (a bitter smile) 'Cept when he was drunk, then he liked me a whole lot. (a moment) I made it back to Atlanta a year later.  Andy was gone. Silence.  Vivian stares out the window.
Aw, but things sure look fine when you're sitting way up high. Edward moves close to Vivian and putting an arm around he shoulders, stares with her out at the view.  Vivian rests head against him.
An airport limo pulls to a stop in front of the San Franc Opera House.  The DRIVER walks around back and opens the passenger door.  Edward emerges and helps Vivian out.
Edward puts his hand on Vivian's elbow as they walk throu the elegant lobby.

Some people say that opera is an acquired taste, but I don't believe it.  You can always tell when someone goes to the opera for the first time.  They either love it or hate it.  Those who love it will always love it; those who hate it might come to appreciate it, but they'll never truly love it. Vivian is wide eyed as they walk past a beautifully lit fountain with several graceful statues in its center. Everywhere she looks she sees elegantly dressed WOMEN and prosperous looking MEN.  It makes her nervous.  Without realizing it, she raises a protective hand up to her neck She looks as if she suspects someone is going to step up steal it.
Viv?  I really doubt if anyone here is going to try and grab it. Vivian reluctantly lowers her hands.

A crowd of PEOPLE mill around the lobby, heading toward t seats.  Vivian is aware of the looks she draws as she pas -- curious, even envious looks from the WOMEN, appreciati glances from the MEN.  Her hands again rises nervously to necklace.
They all think you look very beautiful, Vivian. Vivian gives him a grateful look.  Relaxing, she lowers h from the necklace.  With a flourish, he offers his arm. takes it.  They start forward.
Edward and Vivian take their seats in a box high above th stage.
If it's in Italian, how will I know what they're saying?
I'll whisper some of the main parts of the story to you.  But you'll be surprised how much you understand.  The music conveys the story more powerfully than any words.
But don't they have it in English?
Vivian, don't be afraid of what you don't know.  That's the fun of it. The lights dim.
(resigned) Okay.  Even if I hate it, I'm glad you brought me. The orchestra begins to play.  Vivian's eyes focus intens on the stage, as if a new world is about to be revealed t
IN A MONTAGE OF IMAGES AND MUSIC - LA BOHEME is performed The lights from the stage dance across Vivian's face.  Ed leans over to translate the tenor's aria.

What am I?  I am a poet.  Not a man of wealth but one rich in dreams.  You have come to replace my vanished dreams.  I dwell now only in your eyes. The MUSIC ebbs and swells.  The sets and costumes change. story continues. Edward again leans close to Vivian.

And now she asks Rudolpho if he still thinks her beautiful -- Vivian raises a hand and gently covers Edward's mouth.  H are fixed on the stage.  She doesn't need his help. The emotions building inside Vivian swell as the music is reaching its tragic climax.  Her lips tremble.  Her eyes with tears.  Edward glances at her.  He studies her a lon moment, watching the emotions play unashamedly across her Strangely moved, he takes Vivian's hand. As the opera ends, they are both swept away by it.
As the lights come up, Vivian wipes off her tear-ruined mascara.  She sighs, happy.  The WOMEN in the next box sm at her.
Did you enjoy the opera, dear?
(tearfully) It was so beautiful I just about pissed my pants. Edward smiles at the now shocked looking Older Woman and and the still misty Vivian exit.
Edward and Vivian sit side by side.
If you'd gone on about how much you liked it, I'm not sure I'd have believed you.
I more than liked it.
I know.  I'm glad.
Did you?

Yes.  I've never enjoyed it more. Thank you. Vivian looks at him a moment.  And then, leaning slowly f she kisses him gently on the mouth.  He looks at her surp He puts his arms around her and kisses her back.  It is t first time they've kissed and they make it very special.
The plane flies in the night.  Back to L.A.
IN A SERIES OF CROSS FADES Edward and Vivian make love. Equally giving, equally taking.  No masks, no shields.

In the darkened bedroom, Edward and Vivian lie together. Edward cradles Vivian.  Her back rests against his chest. arm is over her body. She takes Edward's hand in her hands and carefully examin it; marveling at the fingers, the tiny hairs on the back. gently kisses the palm.
Love you... She clutches Edward's hand tightly to her breast.  She cl her eyes, ready to sleep now.
His eyes open.  Vivian's whispered endearment has filled him with sudden confusion and uncertainty.  He stares int dark, wondering what to do with the woman in his arms.
The phone rings.  Edward immediately reaches out and pick up.  He is dressed in a robe.  Breakfast is on the umbrel table in front of him.
Yes?
Stuckey, not even dressed yet, paces around his desk.
Did I wake you?
I'm up.
I had to call.  I jus got off the phone with James Kross.  Get this.  He wants to see you. Today.
Why?
He wouldn't say.  Edward... I think we got him.  His nuts are on the block and we got him. (silence) You there?
Give me twenty minutes.

We'll be there.  Listen, if he's really caving in, we'll go from there down to the office.  I want him to commit his stock to us this morning. Edward hangs up.  His mind seems on other things.  He ris

Vivian is still asleep.  She is face down on the bed, the sheets just covering her to her waist.  Edward stares dow her.  He gently reaches out and runs a finger down the so of her spine.  Vivian murmurs contentedly.
Mmm. (opening her eyes; looking at him) Hi. Edward smiles at her softly.  And then:
Better get dressed.  We're having guests.

Vivian is wearing her yellow dress.  She stares at hersel the bedroom mirror.  Her hair... her make-up... she reali how different she is now, realizes that she likes it. Edward comes out of the bathroom.  He crosses to the clos for a tie.

Here.  Let me. She comes over, starts to tie his tie for him.  He is ver aware of the closeness of her.  She smiles at him.  He sm puts his hand on her stopping her for a moment.  Looking she sees that he is serious now; no more jokes.  He relea her hand.
(quietly) One more night and you're finally rid of me.
Yeah, you've been pretty tough to take.

I have to go to New York tomorrow. Vivian says nothing. EDWARD (cont'd) But I'll be back in Los Angeles. Soon.  I'd like to see you again. I thought we could work out something... An arrangement.
